candidate_rules.condition: If a keyword shows spikes in Google Trends during specific months, it indicates seasonal demand

candidate_rules.condition: If median reviews are below 200, prioritize niches with untapped demand

candidate_rules.condition: If sales show a recent uptick despite overall decline, prioritize the niche

candidate_rules.name: Top 100 Ranking Strategy
candidate_rules.condition: If a category's top 100 rank requires fewer sales than top 10, prioritize it

candidate_rules.name: Low Review Boost
candidate_rules.condition: If median_reviews are less than 200, prioritize tools that provide structured data

candidate_rules.name: Low Competition Boost
candidate_rules.condition: If competitive score is below 40, prioritize keywords for ad campaigns

candidate_rules.name: Keyword Volume Optimization
candidate_rules.condition: If keyword volume is higher than 100, prioritize

candidate_rules.name: Keyword Filtering Rule
candidate_rules.condition: If a keyword has high search volume and low competition, prioritize it

candidate_rules.condition: If the book format is list-based (e.g., trivia, recipes, travel guides), prioritize content generation with ChatGPT

candidate_rules.condition: If content scans as AI-generated (high Originality.ai score), then apply rewriting

candidate_rules.condition: If keywords show low search volume, authors incorrectly dismiss them

candidate_rules.condition: If a keyword has low competitive score and higher monthly earnings than search volume

candidate_rules.name: Low-Barrier Categories
candidate_rules.condition: If a category requires <200 sales to reach #10, prioritize it

candidate_rules.name: Boost Low-Review Niche Products
candidate_rules.condition: If median_reviews is below 200, prioritize boosting

candidate_rules.name: keyword specificity
candidate_rules.condition: If keyword search returns too many results, refine search terms

candidate_rules.name: boost_low_competition_keywords
candidate_rules.condition: If competition score is under 500 and conversion rate is high, prioritize these keywords

candidate_rules.condition: If competitive score <75 and average monthly earnings >$100, prioritize keyword

candidate_rules.name: Top Seller Analysis
candidate_rules.condition: If median_reviews is less than 200, then boost the book's visibility

candidate_rules.name: low review threshold
candidate_rules.condition: If median_reviews is less than 200, prioritize for growth potential

candidate_rules.condition: If a category has high KU percentage, authors should consider KU participation

candidate_rules.name: Sales Validation Heuristic
candidate_rules.condition: If median reviews are below 200 and BSR under 50,000, prioritize keyword

candidate_rules.condition: If books have low review counts, prioritize for niche targeting

candidate_rules.name: Conversion Rate Optimization
candidate_rules.condition: If median reviews are below 200, prioritize keywords with higher conversion potential

candidate_rules.name: review benchmarking
candidate_rules.condition: If median reviews are below 200, prioritize categories with higher review counts

candidate_rules.name: Review Threshold Boost
candidate_rules.condition: If median_reviews is less than 200, boost review collection efforts

candidate_rules.name: Sales Velocity Check
candidate_rules.condition: If a product shows 5,000+ sales past month, it reinforces BSR validity

candidate_rules.name: Prioritize Profitable Niches
candidate_rules.condition: If product has low BSR but high profit margin, prioritize it

candidate_rules.name: Keyword Competition
candidate_rules.condition: If multiple products share identical keywords, those keywords are popular

candidate_rules.name: Recent Sales Indicator
candidate_rules.condition: If BSR is below 500,000 then prioritize

candidate_rules.name: bsr_driven_niche_expansion
candidate_rules.condition: If a book achieves BSR <50000, expand into related sub-niches

candidate_rules.name: Deep Page Niche Selection
candidate_rules.condition: If niche appears on 4th+ page of search results, then it's less competitive

candidate_rules.name: Prioritize 30-Day Sales
candidate_rules.condition: If niche has 169+ 30-day sales average, prioritize over low estimated monthly sales

candidate_rules.name: Template Reuse Strategy
candidate_rules.condition: If creating a new book in a similar niche, reuse existing templates

candidate_rules.name: seasonal demand boost
candidate_rules.condition: If search volume peaks around July holidays, prioritize related niches

candidate_rules.name: Review Volume Benchmark
candidate_rules.condition: If product has fewer than 200 reviews, prioritize for market validation

candidate_rules.name: Low Review Threshold
candidate_rules.condition: If product has low review count, prioritize sales data over BSR

candidate_rules.name: Low Review Competition
candidate_rules.condition: If search results exceed 10,000 but BSR remains above 5 million, prioritize niche opportunities

candidate_rules.name: Validate Keyword Demand
candidate_rules.condition: If a keyword lacks search volume data, penalize its use

candidate_rules.name: Penalize Ghost Categories
candidate_rules.condition: If a category lacks a visible name or links to a browser node, penalize its selection.

candidate_rules.name: BSR Threshold Check
candidate_rules.condition: If the top book's BSR exceeds 10,000, the niche may have poor sales potential

candidate_rules.name: Prioritize Tool Consistency
candidate_rules.condition: If comparing search volume numbers between tools, focus on internal tool data

candidate_rules.name: Price Test Isolation
candidate_rules.condition: If multiple books are tested simultaneously, it may negatively impact sales momentum

candidate_rules.name: title length
candidate_rules.condition: If title exceeds 60 characters, prioritize brevity

candidate_rules.name: Outlier Removal
candidate_rules.condition: If keyword has extreme BSR outliers, filter them out

candidate_rules.name: Keyword Order Optimization
candidate_rules.condition: If keywords are reordered from auto-suggestions, penalize

candidate_rules.name: proportionate_return_check
candidate_rules.condition: If a niche's traffic potential doesn't justify creation costs, avoid it

candidate_rules.name: BSR Penalties
candidate_rules.condition: If BSR is excessively high, penalize niche

candidate_rules.name: Keyword Competition Filter
candidate_rules.condition: If keyword competition exceeds 2,000, avoid the niche.

candidate_rules.name: keyword_variability
candidate_rules.condition: If keywords are repeated across title/subtitle and back office, penalize

candidate_rules.name: competitor_count_filter
candidate_rules.condition: If competitor count exceeds 5,000, avoid keyword

candidate_rules.name: sales_threshold_heuristic
candidate_rules.condition: If category sales thresholds are excessively high, prioritize lower competition categories

candidate_rules.name: Competitor-Search Balance
candidate_rules.condition: If competitors exceed 5000 and estimated searches are below 100, avoid keyword

candidate_rules.name: Penalize High Competition Keywords
candidate_rules.condition: If competitor count exceeds 3000 and search volume below 1000, penalize keyword viability

candidate_rules.name: Competition Score Threshold
candidate_rules.condition: If competition score exceeds 50 for non-public domain books, prioritize lower competition keywords

candidate_rules.name: Category Impact Threshold
candidate_rules.condition: If BSR is above 50,000, category impact on sales is minimal

top_tactics_summary: [high/23x] Keyword Research with Publisher Rocket: Use Publisher Rocket's keyword search tool to analyze market data and identify profitable niches.
[high/17x] Competitor Analysis: Use Publisher Rocket to analyze competitor books' BSR rankings, review counts, and category placements
[high/12x] Category Optimization: Leverage Rocket's category search to identify high-potential Amazon categories
[high/8x] BSR + Review Analysis: Identify trending niches by analyzing bestseller rankings (BSR) and review counts using Publisher Rocket
[high/8x] Category Analysis: Evaluate Amazon categories for niche opportunities using insights tools
[high/8x] Competitor Reverse ASIN: Analyze competitor keywords by reverse ASIN lookup to identify high-performing terms
[high/7x] Publisher Rocket Analysis: Validate niche demand using Publisher Rocket's search volume and competition data.
[high/6x] Keyword Validation: Validate keywords by analyzing search volume, BSR, review counts, and topic saturation
top_patterns_summary: [high/133x] IDENTITY + PROBLEM + CONSTRAINT: Combine specific audience identities with targeted problems and unique constraints
[high/2x] IDENTITY + PROBLEM + CONSTRAINT: Combine specific audience identities with problem-solving keywords and temporal constraints
[high/2x] IDENTITY + Niche + Age Range: Target specific demographics with age-based keyword variations
[high/2x] IDENTITY + PROBLEM + CONSTRAINT: Target underserved niches with minimal competition using free resources
[high/2x] IDENTITY + PROBLEM + CONSTRAINT: Combine specific audience identity with targeted problems and constraints for subniche focus
notes: Publisher Rocket provides estimated search volume data for Amazon keywords; Amazon indexes all keyword combinations in Kindle keyword boxes, not just exact phrases.; Amazon prioritizes relevance over reputation in rankings; 70% of Amazon shoppers never click past the first page of search results; Amazon search results are influenced by customer search history and displayed search terms

pattern_priority.why_it_works: Leverages low review counts and high demand for niche solutions
Balances search volume with niche specificity

pattern_priority.example: children's books + low competition + free tools
pattern_priority.why_it_works: Leverages free tools to create high-quality products without upfront costs
Narrows audience and creates unique market opportunity
Leverages existing demand while exploiting content gaps in niche markets
Captures niche demand while maintaining search volume

pattern_priority.example: children's books + making good choices + specific age groups
pattern_priority.why_it_works: Combines universal parental needs with niche customization
Limits competition while maintaining high demand
Combines search demand with niche-specific creation barriers to reduce competition
Aligns with exact search terms while maintaining low competition
